doc.previous: This equation denotes an uncertainty relation in quantum physics For example with time the observable A the energy E from the Hamiltonian H gives
doc.after: The more precisely one measures the duration of a sequence of events the less precisely one can measure the energy associated with that sequence and vice versa This equation is different from the standard uncertainty principle because time is not an operator in quantum mechanics
